Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2008 04:43PM debphoto wrote: I'm having a double masectomy on April 2. I am relieved that it will be over soon. Good Luck to you. Deb
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2008 02:09PM debphoto wrote: Barbara1 I understand you completely about not being upset that is. I have been expecting my diagnosis for years since both my mom and grandma had cancer (my mom was 42 when diagnosed in 1974) She is my inspiration. She not only beat the breast cancer but she lived to be 78 years old and didn't die of anything related to breast cancer. I agree too, to put this all in God's hands knowing he will take care of me. I am 46 just diagnosed with invasive ductal grade 2 and having a double masectomy on April 2. After chemo, I hope to put this all behind me and get on with life. Deb
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou
